pull_request.title: OQS-CMS
pull_request.body:
This 'activates' CMS sign-verify support for OQS algorithms. Digest is fixed to SHA512.

##### Checklist
- [x] documentation is added or updated
- [x] tests are added or updated

repo.name: openssl
repo.description: Fork of OpenSSL that includes quantum-resistant algorithms and ciphersuites based on liboqs.

repo.name: openssl
repo.description: Fork of OpenSSL that includes quantum-resistant algorithms and ciphersuites based on liboqs.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+###########
+# Run CMS test in OpenSSL 1.1.1 (assume keys and certs have been generated before)
+#
+# Environment variables:
+#  - SIGALG: signature algorithm to use
+###########
+
+set -x
+
+echo "Testdata" > input
+rm -f result
+apps/openssl cms -in input -sign -signer ${SIGALG}_srv.crt -inkey ${SIGALG}_srv.key  -nodetach -outform pem -binary -out output-${SIGALG}.p7s
+apps/openssl cms -verify -CAfile ${SIGALG}_CA.crt  -inform pem -in output-${SIGALG}.p7s -crlfeol -out result
+rm output-${SIGALG}.p7s
+diff result input
comment.body: This script doesn't seem to ever have a non-success return code.

pull_request.title: OQS-CMS
pull_request.body:
This 'activates' CMS sign-verify support for OQS algorithms. Digest is fixed to SHA512.

##### Checklist
- [x] documentation is added or updated
- [x] tests are added or updated

repo.name: openssl
repo.description: Fork of OpenSSL that includes quantum-resistant algorithms and ciphersuites based on liboqs.

repo.name: openssl
repo.description: Fork of OpenSSL that includes quantum-resistant algorithms and ciphersuites based on liboqs.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,77 @@
+FROM debian:buster-slim
+
+ENV HTTPD_VERSION 2.4.41
+
+RUN apt-get update -qq \
+    && apt-get install -y build-essential \
+                          git \
+                          # OQS
+                          autoconf \
+                          automake \
+                          libtool \
+                          libssl-dev \
+                          # httpd
+                          libapr1-dev \
+                          libaprutil1-dev \
+                          libexpat1-dev \
+                          libpcre3-dev \
+                          # misc
+                          wget;
+
+# get sources
+WORKDIR /opt
+RUN git clone --single-branch --branch master https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs && \
+    git clone --single-branch --branch OQS-OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl ossl-src && \
+    wget http://apache.forsale.plus/httpd/httpd-${HTTPD_VERSION}.tar.gz && tar -zxvf httpd-${HTTPD_VERSION}.tar.gz;
comment.body: The URL here is apache.forsale.plus?  That seems really suspicious.

repo.description: Instructions for enabling the use of quantum-safe cryptography in assorted software.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,77 @@
+FROM debian:buster-slim
+
+ENV HTTPD_VERSION 2.4.41
+
+RUN apt-get update -qq \
+    && apt-get install -y build-essential \
+                          git \
+                          # OQS
+                          autoconf \
+                          automake \
+                          libtool \
+                          libssl-dev \
+                          # httpd
+                          libapr1-dev \
+                          libaprutil1-dev \
+                          libexpat1-dev \
+                          libpcre3-dev \
+                          # misc
+                          wget;
+
+# get sources
+WORKDIR /opt
+RUN git clone --single-branch --branch master https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs && \
+    git clone --single-branch --branch OQS-OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl ossl-src && \
+    wget http://apache.forsale.plus/httpd/httpd-${HTTPD_VERSION}.tar.gz && tar -zxvf httpd-${HTTPD_VERSION}.tar.gz;
comment.body: It does sound suspicious, but it is an official apache mirror as per [this list](https://www.apache.org/mirrors/). We could change it, [this stackoverflow answer](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38592289/downloading-file-from-the-right-apache-mirror-with-wget) looks interesting.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,77 @@
+FROM debian:buster-slim
+
+ENV HTTPD_VERSION 2.4.41
+
+RUN apt-get update -qq \
+    && apt-get install -y build-essential \
+                          git \
+                          # OQS
+                          autoconf \
+                          automake \
+                          libtool \
+                          libssl-dev \
+                          # httpd
+                          libapr1-dev \
+                          libaprutil1-dev \
+                          libexpat1-dev \
+                          libpcre3-dev \
+                          # misc
+                          wget;
+
+# get sources
+WORKDIR /opt
+RUN git clone --single-branch --branch master https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs && \
+    git clone --single-branch --branch OQS-OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl ossl-src && \
+    wget http://apache.forsale.plus/httpd/httpd-${HTTPD_VERSION}.tar.gz && tar -zxvf httpd-${HTTPD_VERSION}.tar.gz;
comment.body: Yeah, maybe take the approach in the StackOverflow answer. Or if you want to have a hard-coded URL, then maybe use one of the top Apache ones (www-us.apache.org).
